problem.script: #Enter the computations here hang_mass=random.randrange(300,700,50) table_mass=random.randrange(200,400,10) stretch=random.randrange(20,50,2) amplitude=random.randrange(10,25,1) const=( hang_mass/1000.)*9.8/( stretch/100.) period=2.0*3.14159*math.sqrt(( table_mass/1000.)/ const)
problem.p: If a mass of $hang_mass grams is hung from the bottom of a vertical spring, the spring will stretch $stretch cm. Now the hanging mass is removed, and the spring is placed horizontally on a frictionless table. One end of the spring is held fixed and the other end is attached to a $table_mass gram mass. The mass is then pulled out a distance of $amplitude cm from its equilibrium position and released from rest. What is the period of oscillation of this mass/spring system?
